result.execSummary:
The defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
Consecutive to: with 32 days credit, consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs without a valid prescription.
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment. Absolute Sobriety.

supervisions.notes: COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Omar Saavedra-Horta

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (32 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing 01-13-2016 received and filed.

Defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta in court with Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel, Maria S., and defendant. 
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Court finds defendant IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program  and  IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  36  months  with  32 days credit, consecutive to any other sentence-  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  12  months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  24  months

- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
-  Cooperate with any immigration proceedings
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Alcohol Assessment form, and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Clerk:  jms

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 673

Defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to time constraints, matter adjourned for sentencing.

Parties are informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNT 1as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADA Francesco Mineo unavailable for the rescheduled date.  Telephone call made to Attorney Matthew Luening to rescheduled matter to a different date/time.  ADA Mineo notified of the rescheduled date/time.

Defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Court involved in a Court Trial.  Matter rescheduled for plea/sentencing.  Email sent to ADA Mineo to make sure the rescheduled date fits with his calendar.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court, defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim to appear for sentencing.  Parties request to proceed to plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening via telephone.  Attorney Tyler experiencing car trouble.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter rescheduled for projected guilty plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to Court's congested calendar, matter rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in Court for a decision based on the 06/26/2015 motion hearing regarding the defense motion to suppress statements. Court discussed the materials reviewed and relevant case law. For the reasons stated on the record, the Court found that the defendant's statements were made knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently and therefore denied the defense motion to suppress the statements. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion hearing regarding motion to supress statements proceeded. Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Sheriff's Deputy Steven Geason. Exhibits 1 and 2 received. Testimony closed. Arguments heard. A decision date was selected. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Exhibit list received and filed. Decision scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court on state's motion to adjourn motion hearing.  Defense has no objection.  The Court grants motion to adjourn; new hearing date selected with the parties.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Memorandum of Law in Support of Motion to Suppress Statements made to Police, received and filed.

Defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Motion submitted on today by defense; brief forthcoming.  Hearing date selected with the parties.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Statements Made to Deputies, received and filed.

Defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  
Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status date selected for the purpose of filing and scheduling of motion hearing.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense needs additional time to review discovery materials and offer; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Omar Saavedra-Horta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Erin Karshen for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-27-2015 at 01:30 pm.
